ksrc / skins / posix

jhash.h

00001 /*
00002  * Jenkins hash support, lifted from the Linux kernel from
00003  * linux/include/linux/jhash.h.  We use it to index Xenomai shadow
00004  * TCBs on pthread descriptor addresses.
00005  *
00006  * Original credits:
00007  *
00008  * Copyright (C) 1996 Bob Jenkins (bob_jenkins@burtleburtle.net)
00009  *
00010  * http://burtleburtle.net/bob/hash/
00011  *
00012  * These are the credits from Bob's sources:
00013  *
00014  * lookup2.c, by Bob Jenkins, December 1996, Public Domain.
00015  * hash(), hash2(), hash3, and mix() are externally useful functions.
00016  * Routines to test the hash are included if SELF_TEST is defined.
00017  * You can use this free for any purpose.  It has no warranty.
00018  *
00019  * Copyright (C) 2003 David S. Miller (davem@redhat.com)
00020  *
00021  * I've modified Bob's hash to be useful in the Linux kernel, and
00022  * any bugs present are surely my fault.  -DaveM
00023  */
00024 
00025 #ifndef _XENO_POSIX_JHASH_H
00026 #define _XENO_POSIX_JHASH_H
00027 
00028 /* NOTE: Arguments are modified. */
00029 #define __jhash_mix(a, b, c) \
00030 { \
00031   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>13); \
00032   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<8); \
00033   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>13); \
00034   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>12);  \
00035   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<16); \
00036   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>5); \
00037   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>3);  \
00038   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<10); \
00039   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>15); \
00040 }
00041 
00042 /* The golden ratio: an arbitrary value */
00043 #define JHASH_GOLDEN_RATIO      0x9e3779b9
00044 
00045 /* A special optimized version that handles 1 or more of u32s.
00046  * The length parameter here is the number of u32s in the key.
00047  */
00048 static inline u32 jhash2(const u32 *k, u32 length, u32 initval)
00049 {
00050         u32 a, b, c, len;
00051 
00052         a = b = JHASH_GOLDEN_RATIO;
00053         c = initval;
00054         len = length;
00055 
00056         while (len >= 3) {
00057                 a += k[0];
00058                 b += k[1];
00059                 c += k[2];
00060                 __jhash_mix(a, b, c);
00061                 k += 3; len -= 3;
00062         }
00063 
00064         c += length * 4;
00065 
00066         switch (len) {
00067         case 2 : b += k[1];
00068         case 1 : a += k[0];
00069         };
00070 
00071         __jhash_mix(a,b,c);
00072 
00073         return c;
00074 }
00075 
00076 #endif /* _XENO_POSIX_JHASH_H */
